original: langka'i bdag po khyod la de bzhin gshegs pas skabs phye'i /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po khyod la de bzhin gshegs pas skabs phye'i /
translated: O lord of Laṅkā, the Tathāgata has given you permission.

original: cod pan rab tu g-yo ba ma sdod par ci dang ci 'dod pa nga la dris shig dang / ngas dri ba de dang de'i lung bstan pas ji ltar khyod rnam par rtog pa'i gnas shin tu gyur nas /
analyzed: cod pan rab tu g-yo ba ma sdod par ci dang ci 'dod pa nga la dris shig dang / ngas dri ba de dang de'i lung bstan pas ji ltar khyod rnam par rtog pa'i gnas shin tu gyur nas /
translated: In this way, you will completely transform the basis of your thoughts,🔽and with a mind that is skilled in discerning the factors that are incompatible with the levels, you will analyze the abiding in the bliss of the samādhi of characteristics through the mode of individual knowledge.

original: sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mkhas shing rab tu 'byed pa'i blos so so rang gi rig pa'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bde bar gnas pa la rnam par dpyod cing ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni yongs su bzung /
analyzed: sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mkhas shing rab tu 'byed pa'i blos so so rang gi rig pa'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bde bar gnas pa la rnam par dpyod cing ting nge 'dzin gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni yongs su bzung /
translated: You will be accepted by the buddhas of samādhi,

original: zhi ba'i bde ba la ni rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i bde ba la ni rnam par gnas te /
translated: and you will abide in the bliss of peace.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi nyes pa las 'das nas mi g-yo ba dang / dge ba'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin gyis la ni rnam par gnas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi nyes pa las 'das nas mi g-yo ba dang / dge ba'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin gyis la ni rnam par gnas /
translated: You will transcend the faults of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha samādhis and abide on the levels of Immovable, Excellent Intelligence, and Cloud of Dharma.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin la ni rab tu mkhas pas rin po che'i padmo chen po bting ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal bas dbang bskur ba thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin la ni rab tu mkhas pas rin po che'i padmo chen po bting ba la ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal bas dbang bskur ba thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since they are skilled in the suchness of the absence of self in phenomena, they will attain the empowerment of the king of meditative concentrations on the great precious lotus.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i padmo dag la bdag gi lus rnam pa sna tshogs su byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i padmo dag la bdag gi lus rnam pa sna tshogs su byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs te /
translated: Through the blessing of their bodies transforming into various forms on lotuses that accord with that,🔽they will see their bodies sitting on those lotuses, and they will look at each other’s faces.

original: padmo de dag la bdag gi lus 'dug pa mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gcig gis gdong la gcig lta bar yang byed par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar gang gi phyir bsam @96b gyis mi khyab pa'i yul de ni mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: padmo de dag la bdag gi lus 'dug pa mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gcig gis gdong la gcig lta bar yang byed par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar gang gi phyir bsam @96b gyis mi khyab pa'i yul de ni mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa /
translated: In that way, the inconceivable object is accomplished by the skill in accomplishment.

original: gcig gis mngon par bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig gis mngon par bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: It is accomplished by one.

original: spyod pa'i sa la gnas shing thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba'i mngon par bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa la gnas shing thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba'i mngon par bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrubs pas /
translated: Abiding on the level of practice, they accomplish the accomplishment that is embraced by skill in means.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul de'ang rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs rnam pa mang por rnam par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul de'ang rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs rnam pa mang por rnam par 'gyur ba /
translated: and also attain the inconceivable object.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / nye ba'i dbang po rnams kyis sngon ma mthong ba de'ang thob par 'gyur bar khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / nye ba'i dbang po rnams kyis sngon ma mthong ba de'ang thob par 'gyur bar khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //
translated: You should be delighted that you will attain the many forms of the Tathāgata’s body, which have not been seen before by the hearers, solitary buddhas, tīrthikas, Brahmā, Īśvara, or Upendra.”

original: de nas langka'i bdag po lha mo dang bcas pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: de nas langka'i bdag po lha mo dang bcas pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: Then the lord of Laṅkā, surrounded by a retinue of goddesses,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye bas rin po che'i padmo'i 'od zer gyis dri ma med pa'i 'od rin po che'i padmo dang 'dra ba'i rin po che'i rtse mo de nas langs nas me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye bas rin po che'i padmo'i 'od zer gyis dri ma med pa'i 'od rin po che'i padmo dang 'dra ba'i rin po che'i rtse mo de nas langs nas me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang /
translated: having been given permission by the Blessed One, rose from the jeweled peak, which was like a stainless light of a jeweled lotus, with the light rays of a jeweled lotus, and offered flowers, garlands, incense, perfume,

original: byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan dang / se mo do dang / do shal dang / cod pan dang / thor tshugs rnam pa du ma rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs dang / sngon ma mthong ma thos pa'i rgyan gyi khyad par rnam par 'phags pa gzhan dag dang /
analyzed: byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan dang / se mo do dang / do shal dang / cod pan dang / thor tshugs rnam pa du ma rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs dang / sngon ma mthong ma thos pa'i rgyan gyi khyad par rnam par 'phags pa gzhan dag dang /
translated: He emanated various kinds of ointments, parasols, banners, divine flags, necklaces, garlands, crowns, and topknots, as well as other kinds of extraordinary and superior ornaments that had never been seen or heard before.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / @97a *//
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / @97a *//
translated: He emanated the sounds of the drums and musical instruments of the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, gandharvas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas,🔽as well as the sounds of the drums and musical instruments of humans and of those beyond humans.

original: mi las lhag pa las kyang 'das pa'i rnga dang / sil snyan rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i rol mo'i cha byad thams cad kyang rnam par sprul /
analyzed: mi las lhag pa las kyang 'das pa'i rnga dang / sil snyan rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i rol mo'i cha byad thams cad kyang rnam par sprul /
translated: He emanated all the musical instruments of the desire realm,

original: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gyi rol mo'i khyad par mthong ba de dag kyang mngon par sprul /
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gyi rol mo'i khyad par mthong ba de dag kyang mngon par sprul /
translated: as well as the special musical instruments of other buddha realms that he had seen.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rin po che'i dra bas ni mngon par bkab /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rin po che'i dra bas ni mngon par bkab /
translated: He covered the Blessed One and the bodhisattvas with a jeweled net,

original: gos sna tshogs kyi lha'i ba dan ni rab tu bsgreng /
analyzed: gos sna tshogs kyi lha'i ba dan ni rab tu bsgreng /
translated: raised divine banners of various cloths,

original: ta la bdun tsam du ni nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags /
analyzed: ta la bdun tsam du ni nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags /
translated: rose up into the sky to the height of seven palm trees,

original: mchod pa'i sprin chen po'i char ni mngon par phab /
analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin chen po'i char ni mngon par phab /
translated: caused a great rain of offering clouds to fall,

original: rnga dang sil snyan rnams kyi sgra ni rab tu phyung ste /
analyzed: rnga dang sil snyan rnams kyi sgra ni rab tu phyung ste /
translated: and sounded the music of drums and cymbals.

original: nam mkha' de las babs nas nyi ma dang / glog gi 'od lta bu rin po che'i padma chen pos brgyan pa'i rin po che'i rtse mo gnyis pa la 'dug go /
analyzed: nam mkha' de las babs nas nyi ma dang / glog gi 'od lta bu rin po che'i padma chen pos brgyan pa'i rin po che'i rtse mo gnyis pa la 'dug go /
translated: He descended from the sky and sat on a second jeweled peak adorned with a great jeweled lotus like the light of the sun and lightning.

original: 'dug nas zhe sar 'dzum pa sngon du byas te /
analyzed: 'dug nas zhe sar 'dzum pa sngon du byas te /
translated: Sitting there, he smiled with joy,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis go skabs phye bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis go skabs phye bas /
translated: and since the Blessed One had given him an opportunity,

original: bcom ldan 'das la dri ba gnyis dris so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la dri ba gnyis dris so //
translated: he asked the Blessed One two questions.

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams la'ang bdag gis zhus nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams la'ang bdag gis zhus nas /
translated: He said, I have also asked the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past,

original: de rnams kyis kyang lan glan te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang lan glan te /
translated: They also replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das la'ang da zhu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la'ang da zhu'o //
translated: “We will ask the Blessed One.”

original: bstan pa brjod pa las kyang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams dang khyod kyis kyang gdon mi 'tshal bar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan pa brjod pa las kyang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams dang khyod kyis kyang gdon mi 'tshal bar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: “This will also be taught by the buddhas and by you without doubt, in the teaching of the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos gnyis @97b po 'di ni 'phrul pas sprul pa rnams kyis bstan pa lags te /
analyzed: chos gnyis @97b po 'di ni 'phrul pas sprul pa rnams kyis bstan pa lags te /
translated: these two dharmas are taught by emanations,

original: ngo bo'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: ngo bo'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni ma gsungs so //
translated: not by the essential thus-gone ones.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ngo bo'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i spyod yul ston te /
analyzed: ngo bo'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i spyod yul ston te /
translated: the essential thus-gone ones teach the domain of the sphere of samādhi,

original: tshig gi spyod yul gyi rnam par rtog par ltung ba ni mi ston na /
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul gyi rnam par rtog par ltung ba ni mi ston na /
translated: not the domain of conceptual thoughts of words.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos la mnga' mdzad pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyis chos gnyis po de legs par bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: chos la mnga' mdzad pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyis chos gnyis po de legs par bdag la bshad du gsol /
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha, who has mastery over the Dharma, should teach those two dharmas well to me.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rgyal ba'i sras 'di rnams kyang nyan /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras 'di rnams kyang nyan /
translated: These bodhisattvas will listen,

original: bdag kyang 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and I will also listen.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said,

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: “Lord of Laṅka,

original: chos gnyis po de smros shig /
analyzed: chos gnyis po de smros shig /
translated: speak about those two dharmas.”

original: srin po'i dbang po lus la cod pan dang / dpung rgyan dang; se mo do dang / rdo rje mchog gi phreng ba thogs shing rgyan bzang pos lus brgyan pas gsol pa /
analyzed: srin po'i dbang po lus la cod pan dang / dpung rgyan dang; se mo do dang / rdo rje mchog gi phreng ba thogs shing rgyan bzang pos lus brgyan pas gsol pa /
translated: The lord of rākṣasas, wearing a crown, armlets, bracelets, and a necklace of the best vajras, and with his body adorned with excellent ornaments, said,

original: chos nyid kyang spang bar bgyi na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang spang bar bgyi na /
translated: “If dharmatā is to be abandoned,

original: chos ma mchis par lta ci smos /
analyzed: chos ma mchis par lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to mention non-dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: chos gnyis po de ji ltar spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos gnyis po de ji ltar spang bar 'gyur /
translated: how are those two dharmas abandoned?

original: chos sam / chos ma mchis pa rnams ni gang lags /
analyzed: chos sam / chos ma mchis pa rnams ni gang lags /
translated: What are dharmas and non-dharmas?

original: ji ltar na gnyis spang ba'i chos can rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyis spang ba'i chos can rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa ma lags pa /
translated: How are the two to be abandoned? They are not the nature of conceptual thoughts that fall into the characteristic of conceptual thoughts, nor are they the elements or what is derived from the elements.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rig pas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ma @98a *//
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su ma rig pas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ma @98a *//
translated: Because the foundation consciousness is not fully understood, it lacks specific characteristics

original: mchis pa / skra shad 'dzings pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa /
analyzed: mchis pa / skra shad 'dzings pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa /
translated: and abides in the nature of tangled hair.

original: shes pa ma dag cing zad par 'gyur ba'i yul can /
analyzed: shes pa ma dag cing zad par 'gyur ba'i yul can /
translated: It is the domain of impure and exhausted consciousness.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de dag ji ltar spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de dag ji ltar spang bar 'gyur /
translated: How can such natures be abandoned?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: “Lord of Laṅkā,

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa 'chag pa'i rang bzhin 'jig pa'i chos can rnams byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul la tha dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa 'chag pa'i rang bzhin 'jig pa'i chos can rnams byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul la tha dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba /
translated: it is like this: pots and so forth, which have the nature of breaking and are subject to destruction, appear to the conceptual sphere of childish beings as different and distinct.

original: de bzhin du 'di la'ang ci phyir mi gzung /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la'ang ci phyir mi gzung /
translated: Why should it not be accepted in the same way here?

original: byis pa rnams kyi so so'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi so so'i rnam par rtog pa nye bar bzung na /
translated: If the individual concepts of childish beings are taken into account,

original: chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag kyang yod do //
analyzed: chos dang chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag kyang yod do //
translated: there are also different and distinct phenomena and non-phenomena.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir mthong bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir mthong bas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not seen for the sake of comprehending the wisdom of the noble ones.”

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: O Lord of Lanka,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mtshan nyid sna tshogs su lhung ba rnams byis pa dag gi yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mtshan nyid sna tshogs su lhung ba rnams byis pa dag gi yin te /
translated: the various characteristics of things such as pots are the domain of the childish,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ma yin pa lta zhog la /🔽rang bzhin gcig cing 'bar ba gcig las byung ba'i rab tu 'bar ba khyim dang / gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang pa la 'dug ba shing gi dbang gis 'od ring ba dang thung ba'i khyad par dang tha dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba de bzhin du 'di la'ang chos dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ma yin pa lta zhog la / rang bzhin gcig cing 'bar ba gcig las byung ba'i rab tu 'bar ba khyim dang / gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dang / khang pa la 'dug ba shing gi dbang gis 'od ring ba dang thung ba'i khyad par dang tha dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba de bzhin du 'di la'ang chos dang /
translated: not of the āryas.

original: chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag yod par ci'i phyir mi gzung /
analyzed: chos med pa tha dad pa'i bye brag yod par ci'i phyir mi gzung /
translated: Just as in the case of a house, a building, a garden, or a hut, which arise from a single nature and a single flame, the light appears with different distinctions of long and short due to the wood, in the same way, why would you not accept that there are different distinctions of dharma and non-dharma here as well?

original: me lce'i rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i 'od 'phro ba tha @98b dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba 'ba' zhig tu'ang ma zad de /
analyzed: me lce'i rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i 'od 'phro ba tha @98b dad pa'i bye brag tu snang ba 'ba' zhig tu'ang ma zad de /
translated: It is not only that the light of a single flame of fire appears with different distinctions of long and short due to the wood.

original: langka'i bdag po sa bon gcig las byung yang myu gu dang / ljang bu dang / sog ma dang / tshigs dang / lo ma dang / yal ga dang / me tog dang; 'bras bu dang / gra ma'i bye brag yod pa de bzhin du phyi nang gi chos skye ba'i chos can /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po sa bon gcig las byung yang myu gu dang / ljang bu dang / sog ma dang / tshigs dang / lo ma dang / yal ga dang / me tog dang; 'bras bu dang / gra ma'i bye brag yod pa de bzhin du phyi nang gi chos skye ba'i chos can /
translated: O Lord of Laṅkā, just as a seed produces a sprout, a stalk, leaves, joints, petals, flowers, fruits, and so on, in the same way, all phenomena of the outer and inner worlds, which are subject to arising,

original: ma rig pa las rab tu byung ba /
analyzed: ma rig pa las rab tu byung ba /
translated: come from ignorance.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du gtogs pa thams cad dang / khams gsum du skyes pa'i chos thams cad la bde ba'i dbyibs dang / brjod pa dang 'gro ba'i khyad par dag kyang snang ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched du gtogs pa thams cad dang / khams gsum du skyes pa'i chos thams cad la bde ba'i dbyibs dang / brjod pa dang 'gro ba'i khyad par dag kyang snang ste /
translated: All that is included in the aggregates, elements, and sense sources, and all phenomena that arise in the three realms, appear as the specific shapes, expressions, and movements of happiness.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa yul la mngon par 'dzin par rab tu 'jug pa'i khyad par rab dang 'bring dang tha ma'i bye brag dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa yul la mngon par 'dzin par rab tu 'jug pa'i khyad par rab dang 'bring dang tha ma'i bye brag dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge bar yang snang ngo //
translated: The distinctions of the superior, middling, and inferior aspects of the consciousness that has a single characteristic engaging in the apprehension of objects appear as the distinctions of purification, virtue, and nonvirtue.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: O Lord of Laṅkā!

original: chos de dag gi tha dad pa'i bye brag tu'ang ma zad de /
analyzed: chos de dag gi tha dad pa'i bye brag tu'ang ma zad de /
translated: Not only that,

original: rnal 'byor can rnal 'byor bsgom pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi lam la'ang so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par snang na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can rnal 'byor bsgom pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi lam la'ang so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par snang na /
translated: if the path of yoga of the yogis who cultivate yoga appears as the distinctive characteristics of individual self-awareness,

original: so so'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i chos dang / chos med pa'i khyad par lta ci'i phyir med de yod do //
analyzed: so so'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i chos dang / chos med pa'i khyad par lta ci'i phyir med de yod do //

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang / spu'i khung bu rnams la'ang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as with the eye consciousness, so it is with all the sense faculties, the atoms, and the pores of the skin.

original: me long la cig car dang / rim gyis yul gyi gzugs snang ba dang / rgya mtsho la rlung gis btab pa bzhin du /
analyzed: me long la cig car dang / rim gyis yul gyi gzugs snang ba dang / rgya mtsho la rlung gis btab pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a reflection appears in a mirror all at once and in sequence, and just as the ocean is stirred by the wind,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,🔽the waves of the ocean of mind, stirred by the wind of objects, are characterized by an uninterrupted activity.

original: yul gyi rlung dang / sems kyi rgya mtsho'i rlabs rgyu'i bya ba rgyun mi chad pa'i mtshan nyid gcig dang / tha dad pa las rnam par grol ba las dang rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / shin tu 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid khong du mi chud pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug go /
analyzed: yul gyi rlung dang / sems kyi rgya mtsho'i rlabs rgyu'i bya ba rgyun mi chad pa'i mtshan nyid gcig dang / tha dad pa las rnam par grol ba las dang rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / shin tu 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid khong du mi chud pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug go /
translated: They are free from being the same or different.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,🔽the fivefold group of consciousnesses engages in the nature that is the characteristic of action and type, which is very closely related, without understanding the essence that is the nature of non-apprehension.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po de dag dang lhan cig tu rgyu dang yul gyi bye brag 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag gi rgyu las byung pa'i bdag nyid rab tu 'jug ste
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po de dag dang lhan cig tu rgyu dang yul gyi bye brag 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag gi rgyu las byung pa'i bdag nyid rab tu 'jug ste
translated: The mental consciousness, which is the cause of the five collections of consciousness, arises from them and is their nature. It is called “the one that understands the distinctions of causes and objects.”

original: / de dag dang de 'di snyam du bdag cag ni lhan cig tu phan tshun rgyur gyur cing /🔽rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam @114a *//
analyzed: / de dag dang de 'di snyam du bdag cag ni lhan cig tu phan tshun rgyur gyur cing / rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam @114a *//
translated: They do not think, “We are causes for each other and arise together.

original: par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas zhugs pa'o snyam du ma sems so //
analyzed: par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pas zhugs pa'o snyam du ma sems so //
translated: We engage in the conceptual thoughts that are the appearances of our own minds.”

original: 'on kyang phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du lhan cig rnam par rig pa'i yul bye brag 'byed pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid du lhan cig rnam par rig pa'i yul bye brag 'byed pa la 'jug ste /
translated: However, they engage in distinguishing the objects of consciousness without being different from each other.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i tshe mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnal 'byor can gyis kyang ji ltar shin tu phra bar rgyu ba'i bag chags 'jug pa rnams mi shes par rgyu'i /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i tshe mnyam par bzhag pa'i rnal 'byor can gyis kyang ji ltar shin tu phra bar rgyu ba'i bag chags 'jug pa rnams mi shes par rgyu'i /
translated: When they engage in this way, even yogis who are in equipoise do not know how the extremely subtle habitual tendencies engage.

original: rnal 'byor can rnams ni 'di ltar bdag cag rnam par shes pa rnams bkag nas snyoms par 'jug go snyam du sems kyang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can rnams ni 'di ltar bdag cag rnam par shes pa rnams bkag nas snyoms par 'jug go snyam du sems kyang /
translated: The yogis and yoginis think, “We enter meditative absorption by stopping the consciousnesses.”

original: de dag ni rnam par shes pa ma 'gags bzhin du snyoms par 'jog ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par shes pa ma 'gags bzhin du snyoms par 'jog ste /
translated: But they enter meditative absorption while the consciousnesses are still operating.

original: bag chags kyi sa bon ma 'gags pa'i phyir ni ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi sa bon ma 'gags pa'i phyir ni ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Because the seeds of habitual tendencies are not stopped, they are not stopped.

original: yul la 'jug cing 'dzin pa med pas ni 'gags so //
analyzed: yul la 'jug cing 'dzin pa med pas ni 'gags so //
translated: But because they do not engage with and apprehend objects, they are stopped.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu zhing 'jug pa de ltar shin tu phra bas de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par gzhan nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis khong du chud pa'am /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu zhing 'jug pa de ltar shin tu phra bas de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par gzhan nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis khong du chud pa'am /
translated: the cause and activity of the consciousness of the ground of all is extremely subtle. Other than the Tathagatas and the bodhisattvas who are established on the grounds, it is not something that can be understood by the Shravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, or the yogis and yoginis of the tirthikas.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs kyis kyang rtogs par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs kyis kyang rtogs par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not something that can be easily realized even by the power of samadhi and wisdom.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: gzhan du na sa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes rab dang / ye shes la mkhas shing /
analyzed: gzhan du na sa'i mtshan nyid dang / shes rab dang / ye shes la mkhas shing /
translated: Otherwise, those who are skilled in the characteristics of the earth, in wisdom, and in gnosis,

original: tshig rab tu phye ba la rnam par gdon mi za ba rgyal @114b ba rnams la mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa /
analyzed: tshig rab tu phye ba la rnam par gdon mi za ba rgyal @114b ba rnams la mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa /
translated: who have accumulated limitless roots of virtue,

original: rang gi sems snang ba la rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba la rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba /
translated: who are free from the conceptual elaborations of their own mental appearances,

original: nags tshal stug po dang / phug dang shing khrod na gnas shing rnal 'byor rab dang 'bring dang tha ma la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rgyud mthong ba dang / zhing mtha' yas pa'i rgyal ba rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: nags tshal stug po dang / phug dang shing khrod na gnas shing rnal 'byor rab dang 'bring dang tha ma la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rgyud mthong ba dang / zhing mtha' yas pa'i rgyal ba rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: who dwell in dense forests, caves, and groves, and who are yogins of the highest, middling, and lowest [stages] are able to see the continuum of the appearances of their own mental concepts, to be empowered by the victors of limitless realms,

original: dbang dang / stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang thob par nus so //
analyzed: dbang dang / stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang thob par nus so //
translated: and to attain the powers, superknowledges, and samādhis.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi skye bo la ri mor byas pa rnams kyis sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi sems snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa'i 'khor ba srid pa'i rgya mtsho las dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi skye bo la ri mor byas pa rnams kyis sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi sems snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa'i 'khor ba srid pa'i rgya mtsho las dang /
translated: Those who have made images of spiritual masters will have minds, thoughts, and mental consciousnesses that are the domain of the nature of their own mind’s appearances, free from the saṃsāra of conceptuality, the ocean of existence.

original: sred pa dang / mi shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba las rgal bar nus so //
analyzed: sred pa dang / mi shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba las rgal bar nus so //
translated: Those who have honored the spiritual friend are able to cross the ocean of cyclic existence, which is the domain of the mind, mentality, and consciousness, the nature of one’s mind’s appearances, and which arises from the causes of karma, craving, and ignorance.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor can gyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi skye bo dang bsten pa'i nan tan brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor can gyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi skye bo dang bsten pa'i nan tan brtsam par bya'o //
translated: therefore, the practitioner should strive to rely on the spiritual friend.

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One spoke these verses:

analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i dba' rlabs rnams //

analyzed: rlung gi rkyen gyis byung ba dag / gar cing rab tu 'byung ba ni //

analyzed: rgyun yang rnam par 'chad pa med //

original: kun gzhi chu po de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi chu po de bzhin du //

original: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni sems kyi rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid dang bral ba /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: dang; sems dang / shes rab dang / ye shes dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rnam par thar pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu phye ba rgyu ba rnam par bzhag go /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni dmigs pa med cing dmigs pa dang bral ba /

analyzed: bya ba dang / dbang po dang / tshad ma'i mtshan nyid thams cad las rnam par log pa /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la brtson par bya'o //

analyzed: khyod kyis rang gi sems kyi mtshan nyid snang ba'ang rnam par log par lta bar gyis shig /

analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis so //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i @122b khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: what is the distinctive characteristic of the noble individual self-realization of the Śrāvakayāna?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa'i yul gyi bde ba las skyo ba dang / rgyun chad pas phung po dang; khams dang / skye mched dang / rang dang spyi'i phyi rol rnam par 'jig pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pas sems mnyam par gzhog ste; blo gros chen po /

analyzed: rang gi sems mnyam par bzhag nas nyan thos rnams bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / lam dang / 'bras bu dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par grol pa dang / bag chags bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su gyur pa shi 'pho dang bral ba /
translated: Mahāmati, having settled his own mind, he causes the śrāvakas to realize the dhyānas, liberations, samādhis, paths, fruits, meditative absorptions, liberations, and the inconceivable transformation of their habitual tendencies, free from death and rebirth.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i bde ba la gnas pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i bde ba la gnas pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur ro //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i gnas kyi bde ba khong du chud nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sngon sems can rnams la snying brtse bar bltas te /

original: blo gros chen po /🔽'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa so @123a *//
analyzed: blo gros chen po / 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi 'phags pa so @123a *//
translated: Mahāmati,

original: so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba ste /
analyzed: so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba ste /
translated: this is the happiness of the defining characteristic of the noble ones’ personal realization of the hearers.

analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid bde ba de la byang chub sems dpas bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should not train in that happiness of the defining characteristic of the noble ones’ personal realization.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: yang nyan thos rnams kyi dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Moreover, Mañjuśrī, what is the nature of the śrāvakas’ conceptualization and clinging to things?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dro ba dang / gsher ba dang; g-yo ba dang / sra ba'i 'byung ba chen po rnams byed pa med par 'byung ba dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rigs pa dang / lung dang / tshad ma shin tu 'brel ba rnams mthong nas de'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dro ba dang / gsher ba dang; g-yo ba dang / sra ba'i 'byung ba chen po rnams byed pa med par 'byung ba dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rigs pa dang / lung dang / tshad ma shin tu 'brel ba rnams mthong nas de'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Having seen the great elements of blue, yellow, red, white, heat, moisture, movement, and solidity arise without activity, and having seen the very connectedness of their specific and general characteristics, reasonings, scriptures, and valid cognitions, the conceptualization of clinging to their nature arises.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpas khong du chud nas bzlog par bya'o //

original: sa'i rim pa'i mtshams sbyor ba la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i rim pa'i mtshams sbyor ba la gnas par bya'o //
translated: He should abide in the connection with the stages of the levels.

original: blo gros chen po; 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ces gang smras pa de'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po; 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ces gang smras pa de'i phyir bshad do //
translated: “Mahāmati, this is what I have been explaining when I said that the defining characteristic of the śrāvakas’ conceptual nature is their attachment to things.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul don dam pa @123b rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa bshad de /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de bzhin du mu stegs byed pa dag kyang rgyu rnams rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par smra ba mchis so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyi rgyu ni rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams kyi rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

translated: how could that which is permanent and inconceivable be called permanent and inconceivable if it does not have the characteristics of causes?

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

translated: if the proponents of permanence and inconceivability had the characteristics of causes, they would have the characteristics of causes that depend on conditions, and therefore would be impermanent,

analyzed: rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par ma yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: nga'i don dam pa rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni don dam pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ste /
translated: my ultimate, which is permanent and inconceivable, has the characteristics of ultimate causes.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang bral ba /

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang bral bas na ma byas pa'i @124a *//
translated: It is unfabricated because it is free from existence and nonexistence.

analyzed: nam mkha' dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa'i dpe dang chos 'dra bas rtag pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: 'di ni mu stegs byed pa'i rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par smra ba dang mthun pa ma yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis thugs su chud par bya ba'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis thugs su chud par bya ba'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: this permanence and inconceivability is the suchness to be realized by the tathāgatas’ noble individual self-awareness.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

translated: furthermore, the permanence and inconceivability of the tīrthikas are impermanent because they arise from the cause of the characteristics of impermanent non-entities.

analyzed: bdag gis byas pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye bas rtag pa ma yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de ste mu stegs byed pa rnams kyi rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa byas pa'i dngos po med pas rtag pa nyid du mthong nas rjes su dpog pa'i blos rtag pa yin na ni /
translated: if the permanence and inconceivability of the tīrthikas were seen as permanent because of the non-existence of a produced entity and were inferred by the mind,🔽Mahāmati,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: rgyu 'di nyid kyis nga'i yang byas pa'i dngos po med pas rtag pa nyid du mthong nas rgyu med par bstan pa'i phyir rtag pa'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni dngos po thams cad rgyu la rag las par mthong nas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa'i blor @126b 'gyur te /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis lta ba ngan pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir brtson par bya'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i rigs can du shes nas /

analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs can gyi mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: blo gros chen po; de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin med pa'i chos mngon par rtogs par @127a *//

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba zhig bstan pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba'i lus dang / kun gzhi dang / longs spyod dang / gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul bstan pa ni mi 'jigs /
analyzed: de rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba zhig bstan pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba'i lus dang / kun gzhi dang / longs spyod dang / gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul bstan pa ni mi 'jigs /
translated: if any of these three is taught, and if the inconceivable objects of the body, the ground of all, enjoyments, and abode that appear to one’s own mind are taught, and if [the disciple] is not frightened,

analyzed: mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur na /

analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs can du shes par bya ste /

original: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: phyi nang gi chos thams cad mi dmigs shing rang bzhin med pa'i rjes su mthong ba'i phyir skye ba'i lta ba rnam par log nas /
translated: Because they do not observe any phenomena, either internal or external, and because they see that they have no intrinsic nature, they turn away from the view of origination.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin du rjes su rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu 'thob ste /🔽sa brgyad la gnas nas sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa khong du chud pa'i phyir yid kyi lus kyang rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin du rjes su rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu 'thob ste / sa brgyad la gnas nas sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa rab tu gyur pa khong du chud pa'i phyir yid kyi lus kyang rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Because they realize that phenomena are by nature like illusions and so forth, they attain patient acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: When they reach the eighth bhumi, they attain the body of mind because they have realized the transformation of the mind, the mental faculty, the consciousnesses of the five sense doors, the five faculties, the five governing powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the eightfold means of spiritual accomplishment, the two kinds of fearlessness, the two kinds of omniscience, the five kinds of transcendent knowledge, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, and the two kinds of no-self.

original: ci'i slad du yid kyi lus zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du yid kyi lus zhes bgyi /
translated: Mahamati, why is it called the body of mind?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: yid kyi lus zhes bya ba ni yid ltar thogs pa med cing mgyogs par 'gro ba'i phyir yid kyi lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi lus zhes bya ba ni yid ltar thogs pa med cing mgyogs par 'gro ba'i phyir yid kyi lus zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called the body of mind because it is like the mind in that it is unobstructed and moves quickly.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: yid ni ri dang / rtsig pa dang / 'bab chu dang / shing la sogs pa la thogs pa med par dpag tshad @138b brgya stong du mar sngon mthong ba dang / myong ba'i yul rjes su dran zhing rang gi sems kyi rgyun ma chad pa'i lus thogs pa med pa'i 'gros kyis 'jug go /
analyzed: yid ni ri dang / rtsig pa dang / 'bab chu dang / shing la sogs pa la thogs pa med par dpag tshad @138b brgya stong du mar sngon mthong ba dang / myong ba'i yul rjes su dran zhing rang gi sems kyi rgyun ma chad pa'i lus thogs pa med pa'i 'gros kyis 'jug go /
translated: The mind is unimpeded by mountains, walls, waterfalls, trees, and so forth. It can recall objects seen and experienced in the past, even at distances of hundreds of thousands of leagues.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin du yid kyi lus kyang thob ma thag tu sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis stobs dang / dbang dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang / mtshan nyid kyi me tog rgyas pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi lus kyang thob ma thag tu sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis stobs dang / dbang dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang / mtshan nyid kyi me tog rgyas pa /
translated: in the same way, as soon as the mental body is attained, through the samādhi that is like an illusion, it is endowed with the power of the superknowledges, pristine awareness, and the blooming of the flower of characteristics.

original: 'phags pa'i ris su lhan cig skyes pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ris su lhan cig skyes pa /
translated: It is born in the family of the noble ones,

original: 'gro ba la thogs pa med pa sngon gyi smon lam gyi yul rjes su dran zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yid bzhin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba la thogs pa med pa sngon gyi smon lam gyi yul rjes su dran zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yid bzhin du 'jug ste /
translated: and is unimpeded in its movement through the world. It recalls the objects of its previous aspirations and, as it wishes, it engages in bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: de ltar na; blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de ltar na; blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i lta ba rnam par spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i lta ba rnam par spangs pa yin no //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas abandon the views of arising, abiding, and destruction.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med par rtogs pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med par rtogs pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattva-mahāsattvas skilled in realizing external entities as non-entities?

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: dngos po thams cad ni smig rgyu dang; rmi lam dang / skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni smig rgyu dang; rmi lam dang / skra shad 'dzings pa lta bu'o //
translated: All entities are like a mirage, a dream, and matted hair.

original: dngos po thams cad ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /
translated: All entities arise from the cause of clinging to the various habitual tendencies of conceptual thoughts, the negative tendencies of conceptual elaborations since beginningless time.

original: rang bzhin med pa'o zhes yang dag par mthong nas 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i yul la mngon par mos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'o zhes yang dag par mthong nas 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i yul la mngon par mos so //
translated: Having seen that they are essenceless, they aspire to the object realized by the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: @139a *// blo gros chen po /
analyzed: @139a *// blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos 'di bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor can yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rnal 'byor can yin no //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses these four dharmas is one who practices the great yoga.

original: blo gros chen po; de la khyod kyis brtson par gyis shig /
analyzed: blo gros chen po; de la khyod kyis brtson par gyis shig /
translated: Mahāmati, you should strive in that.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos gsol ba btab pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das; rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa gang gis bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams mchis pa dang / ma mchis par lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhing dngos po thams cad rim gyis dang / cig car skye bar rnam par mi rtog par mi 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu dang /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos gsol ba btab pa / bcom ldan 'das; rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa gang gis bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams mchis pa dang / ma mchis par lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhing dngos po thams cad rim gyis dang / cig car skye bar rnam par mi rtog par mi 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu dang /
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati made a request:

original: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid bdag la bshad du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please explain to me the characteristics of causes and conditions, by realizing which I and other bodhisattvas will be free from the conceptual thoughts of views of existence and non-existence, and will not conceive of all things as arising gradually or instantaneously. Please explain to me the characteristics of causes and conditions of all dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos thams cad kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics of the dependent origination of all phenomena are twofold:

original: 'di ltar phyi'i dang / nang gi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i dang / nang gi'o //
translated: external and internal.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / lag zungs dang / 'khor lo dang / srad bu dang / chu dang / mi'i nan tan la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis rdza ma 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / lag zungs dang / 'khor lo dang / srad bu dang / chu dang / mi'i nan tan la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis rdza ma 'byung ngo //
translated: the external dependent origination is that a pot arises from the conditions of a lump of clay, a rope, a wheel, a string, water, a human effort, and so forth.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ji ltar 'jim pa'i gong bu las rdza ma 'byung ba de bzhin du thag pa las sna ma bu dang / rtsi skyang las re lde dang / sa bon las myu gu dang / @139b srub ma la sogs pa mi'i nan tan dang / zho las mar 'byung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jim pa'i gong bu las rdza ma 'byung ba de bzhin du thag pa las sna ma bu dang / rtsi skyang las re lde dang / sa bon las myu gu dang / @139b srub ma la sogs pa mi'i nan tan dang / zho las mar 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: just as a pot arises from a lump of clay, so a mat arises from a rope, a basket arises from reeds, a sprout arises from a seed, and butter arises from curd through the human effort of churning and so forth.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi mar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi mar 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is the external dependent origination, arising from earlier to later.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal dependent origination is as follows:

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / chos 'di dag la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo; ;blo gros chen po /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / chos 'di dag la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo; ;blo gros chen po /
translated: Ignorance, craving, and karma—these phenomena and so forth obtain the name dependent origination.

original: 'di dag las skyes pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ces bya ba'i chos de dag kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'di dag las skyes pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched ces bya ba'i chos de dag kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: Mahāmati, those phenomena called the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that arise from these obtain the name dependent origination.

original: de dag ni khyad par med pa las byis pa rnams kyis brtags so //
analyzed: de dag ni khyad par med pa las byis pa rnams kyis brtags so //
translated: They are imputed by the childish without distinction.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la rgyu ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: there are six kinds of causes:

original: 'di ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / 'brel pa'i rgyu dang / mtshan nyid kyi rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang / snang bar byed pa'i rgyu dang / ltos pa'i rgyu dang drug go /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / 'brel pa'i rgyu dang / mtshan nyid kyi rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang / snang bar byed pa'i rgyu dang / ltos pa'i rgyu dang drug go /
translated: the cause of becoming, the related cause, the characteristic cause, the acting cause, the illuminating cause, and the dependent cause.

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skye ba'i phyir rgyu'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skye ba'i phyir rgyu'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The cause of emergence performs the function of a cause in order to generate outer and inner phenomena.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'brel ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi phung po dang / sa bon la sogs pa 'byung ba'i dmigs pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i rgyu ni phyi nang gi phung po dang / sa bon la sogs pa 'byung ba'i dmigs pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: the related cause performs the function of the observed object that gives rise to the outer and inner aggregates, seeds, and so on.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni de ma thag tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel ba skyed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni de ma thag tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'brel ba skyed do //
translated: the causal characteristic cause produces the characteristics of the immediately preceding condition.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byed pa'i rgyu ni dbang bar gtogs pa'i bya ba byed de /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ni dbang bar gtogs pa'i bya ba byed de /
translated: the acting cause performs the function of the faculties,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin no //
translated: like a universal monarch.

original: blo gros chen po /🔽snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par @140a *//
analyzed: blo gros chen po / snang bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam par @140a *//
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rtog pa'i dngos po skyes pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba'i bya ba byed de /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dngos po skyes pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba'i bya ba byed de /
translated: the illuminating cause performs the function of illumination, the characteristic of the arising of conceptual things.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mar me bzhin no //
translated: It is like a lamp for forms and so on.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ltos pa'i rgyu ni rnam par ldog pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i phyir rgyun gyi bya ba mi 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rgyu ni rnam par ldog pa'i dus na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i phyir rgyun gyi bya ba mi 'chad par byed do //
translated: The causal condition is that which causes the continuity of activity to be uninterrupted, because when the cessation of the effect occurs, the nonconceptual entity arises.

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa ste /🔽rim gyis 'jug pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa ste / rim gyis 'jug pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: are the conceptual imputations of the minds of foolish ordinary beings.🔽They do not occur gradually,

original: cig car yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: cig car yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: nor do they occur instantaneously.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gal te cig car 'byung na ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid du ma reg pa'i phyir bya ba dang byed pa'i bye brag kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te cig car 'byung na ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid du ma reg pa'i phyir bya ba dang byed pa'i bye brag kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if they occurred instantaneously, then because they would not touch the characteristics of causes, there would be no distinction between action and agent.

original: de ste rim gyis 'jug pas 'byung na ni mtshan nyid du ma reg pa'i bdag nyid las rim gyis 'jug par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ste rim gyis 'jug pas 'byung na ni mtshan nyid du ma reg pa'i bdag nyid las rim gyis 'jug par mi 'byung ste /
translated: If they occurred gradually, then they would not occur gradually from a nature that does not touch characteristics.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: bu ma skyes par pha zhes gdags pa dang 'dra bar rtog pa pa rnams kyi rim gyis 'jug pas 'brel ba'i tshul yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bu ma skyes par pha zhes gdags pa dang 'dra bar rtog pa pa rnams kyi rim gyis 'jug pas 'brel ba'i tshul yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is like calling someone a father before he has a son.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen la sogs pas bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa'i phyir rim gyis 'jug pas mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen la sogs pas bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa'i phyir rim gyis 'jug pas mi skye ste /
translated: because of the conditions of cause, object, immediate antecedent, and dominant, and because of the production and non-production, there is no gradual or instantaneous arising.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rim gyis sam cig car mi skye'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rim gyis sam cig car mi skye'o //
translated: because of the characteristic of attachment to the imagined nature, there is no gradual or instantaneous arising.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i lus @140b dang; longs spyod can yin pa'i phyir rang dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir rim gyis sam cig car yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i lus @140b dang; longs spyod can yin pa'i phyir rang dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir rim gyis sam cig car yang mi skye ste /
translated: because of the body and enjoyments that appear to one's own mind, and because of the non-existence of external things with general and specific characteristics, there is no gradual or instantaneous arising.

original: gzhan du na rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par brtags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du na rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par brtags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, consciousness would arise because of the conceptualization of the appearances of one’s own mind.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de lta bas na khyod kyis rgyu dang rkyen dang / byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid rim pa'am cig car du lta ba dang bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyod kyis rgyu dang rkyen dang / byed pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid rim pa'am cig car du lta ba dang bral bar bya'o //
translated: therefore, you should be free from the view of causality, conditions, and the characteristics of activity, either sequentially or simultaneously.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /🔽'di la gang yang rkyen rnams kyis //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste / 'di la gang yang rkyen rnams kyis //
translated: Regarding this, it is said:🔽Here, there is no arising or ceasing

original: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med //
translated: due to conditions.

original: btags pa'i rkyen rnams kho na ni //
analyzed: btags pa'i rkyen rnams kho na ni //
translated: Only the conditions of imputation

original: skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur yin no //
analyzed: skye zhing 'gag par 'gyur yin no //
translated: arise and cease.

original: skye 'jig rkyen la 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: skye 'jig rkyen la 'brel pa ni //
translated: The connection of arising and ceasing with conditions

original: rnam par bzlog par mi bya ste //
analyzed: rnam par bzlog par mi bya ste //
translated: should not be refuted.

original: byis pa rkyen gyis gang rtog pa //
analyzed: byis pa rkyen gyis gang rtog pa //
translated: The conceptualization of childish beings due to conditions

original: de ni rnam par bzlog par bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par bzlog par bya //
translated: should be refuted.

original: bag chags rnams kyis rmongs byas sems //
analyzed: bag chags rnams kyis rmongs byas sems //
translated: The mind, deluded by traces,

original: srid gsum dag na snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid gsum dag na snang ba'i phyir //
translated: appears in the three existences.

original: rkyen rnams yod dang med las kyang //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod dang med las kyang //
translated: Therefore, due to the existence and non-existence of conditions,🔽the mind is not seen.

original: chos rnams 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: Phenomena do not arise.

original: ma byung rkyen gyis skye ba med //
